source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae

source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Standard more than 6 mm long and 4 mm wide; leaf margins slightly incurved or involute, smooth, glabrous
Standard c. 6 mm long, 4 mm wide; leaf margins flat, tuberculate, ciliate when immature
Leaves usually tuberculate abaxially; both surfaces green; bracteoles inserted on pedicel 0.5–1 mm below calyx tube
Leaves not tuberculate; abaxial surface usually with a broad central purple-brown band; bracteoles inserted immediately below calyx tube
